item.title: 18.1M COVID-19 cases worldwide, death toll at 689,758 with more than 10.5M recoveries
item.description: At least 18,109,730 coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases have been registered in 196 countries and territories. Of these, at least 10,505,100 are now considered recovered while at least 689,758 people have died since the outbreak emerged in China last December, according to a tally from official sources compiled by AFP at 1100 GMT on Monday.

item.title: Gordon won't let Bato lead Senate hearings on death penalty bill
item.description: "Sasabihin niya dahil ako ay against death penalty, sasabihin niya biased ako, lalong hindi ko ibibigay sa kaniya dahil siya ang biased talaga. Sinasabi niya aggressively na siya ay for the death penalty," Gordon said.

item.title: Health workers' frustration expected after Duterte lambasted plea for timeout --Lacson
item.description: "Kung sa kanila I heard libo ang tine-treat daily at exposed na exposed at maraming namatay sa kanila. So emotions are high. I would like to think na may frustration talaga dahil sa halip na pakinggan intently ang kanilang sinasabi para ma-improve ang situation, parang may halo pang pananakot," Senator Panfilo Lacson said.

item.title: Linta na pumasok sa mata, paano aalisin?
item.description: Hindi lang isa, kung hindi ilang mountaineers na ang nabibiktima ng mga linta o limatik na pumapasok sa mata. Pero sa halip na gamitan ng kung anumang bagay tulad ng tiyani para maalis ang limatik, may mas ligtas daw na paraan. Alamin kung ano.

item.title: Former king Juan Carlos to leave Spain after scandal reports
item.description: Spain's former king Juan Carlos has told his son, King Felipe VI, that he decided to leave Spain, the royal house said in a statement on Monday, after corruption allegations about him had surfaced in recent weeks.

item.title: Vatican: Ex-pope Benedict's condition 'not particularly worrying'
item.description: The Vatican, responding to a German newspaper report that former Pope Benedict's condition was serious, said it was "not particularly worrying" and that he was overcoming the acute phase of a painful but not grave ailment.

item.title: Sotto reminds FDCP: Production not within your mandate
item.description: Senate President Vicente Sotto III on Monday said the Film Development Council of the Philippines (FDCP) should not meddle with the production process of movies in the country amid the pandemic because they are not mandated to do so.

item.title: Lumang bayan ng Pantabangan, bakit isinakripisyong gawing dam?
item.description: Taong 1970's nang palubugin sa tubig ang lumang bayan ng Pantabangan sa Nueva Ecija upang gawin dam. Bakit nga ba napili ang naturang bayan na isakripisyo at ano ang nangyari sa mga taong naninirahan sa lugar?

item.title: Sotto kids Bato after flattery fails on Drilon during interpellation
item.description: Senator Vicente Sotto III quipped on Monday night that flattery does not always work in the upper chamber after neophyte Senator Ronald "Bato" Dela Rosa faced questions from Senate Minority Franklin Drilon.

item.title: CRS outlets in NCR, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Rizal to be closed during MECQ --PSA
item.description: Civil Registration System outlets in Metro Manila, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, and Rizal will be closed while the modified enhanced community quarantine is in effect, the Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA) announced Monday.

item.title: Misis, 'di raw niya gustong patayin ang asawa na sinilaban niya nang buhay
item.description: Marami ang nagimbal nang maibalita ang isang ginang na sinilaban nang buhay ang kaniyang mister habang natutulog sa kanilang bahay sa Pampanga. Ano nga ba ang nagtulak sa ginang para magliyab sa galit at silaban ang kaniyang mister na binawian ng buhay.

item.title: Some Metro Manila mayors prepare anew for MECQ
item.description: Several local chief executives in Metro Manila on Monday have begun preparing anew for stricter quarantine protocols after President Rodrigo Duterte announced the reimposition of modified enhanced community quarantine (MECQ) over Metro Manila and nearby areas.

item.title: COVID-19 infected personnel now at 2,249 -PNP
item.description: The number of police officers infected with COVID-19 reached 2,283 on Monday after the Philippine National Police reported 34 new cases.

item.title: 96 more LSIs return home to Sulu, Tawi-Tawi --BARMM
item.description: Ninety-six more locally stranded individuals were sent home to Sulu and Tawi-Tawi on Monday, according to the Bangsamoro government.

item.title: Manila residents fear hunger, face uncertainty anew under MECQ
item.description: “ Yon nga problema. Saan na naman kami kukuha ng aming kabuhayan? Yong mga nagbibigay ng mga pagkain sa kalsada, humahabol kami sa mga sasakyan, yong mga nagbibigay ng pagkain doon ako naiiyak kasi ang lakas-lakas ko pa mag-hanapbuhay tapos nanghihingi kami pagkain,” a Manila resident said amid the stricter quarantine.
